reviews.text: We had a lovely meal here. Very tasty with good portions. No complains at all. Vegetable chilli and chilli chicken went down well. Burger was large and tasty.Real ale for those who want it and very attentive service. Key lime pie finished it all well. Will go back if in area.
reviews.title: Good food warm atmosphere

reviews.text: A warm and comfortable inn complete with roaring fire. Good varied menu and choice of local beers. Very friendly, obliging and helpful staff. Reasonable prices. Situated in centre of Threlkeld village. Parking.
reviews.title: WALKING WEEK

reviews.text: Havin not been to threlkeld for a few years, me and my good wife visited the salutation, the sally@ threlkeld.i must say the exterior and interior the pub makeover is a credit to the owners..the 2 guys that were behind the bar could not do enough for us from start to finish. I was made up to see they had 4 cask ales on lovely. .we had the scampi and the fresh cod and chips (fries) which were both bloody lovely, then we had the desserts which were just as good..we left stuffed little pigges..hope to go back in September. ..yet again well done staff and owners.
reviews.title: Well done

reviews.text: We stayed in Threlkeld on a lovely camp site in our caravan near to the village Golf Club. A ten minute walk brought us into the delightful village of Threlkeld where we discovered a lovely village pub called the "Sally". This became our place to eat each evening during our 5 night stay here.
reviews.title: Excellent but shame about the skip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pub has recently been refurbished and is lovely with service from excellent members of staff. The food was very good with a good choice on the menu.
reviews.title: Great pub, food, drink, service and ambience
